t: Genesis 49
Jacob Blesses His Sons
Then*p Jacob called his sons and said, “Gather yourselves together, that I may tell you what shall happen to you in days to come.
“Assemble*pn and listen, O sons of Jacob, listen*ld to Israel your father.
“Reuben,*pn you are my firstborn, my*ld might, and the firstfruits of my strength, preeminent*ld in dignity and preeminent in power.
Unstable*ln as water, you shall not have preeminence, because*ld you went up to your father’s bed; then*ld you defiled it— he went up to my couch!
“Simeon*pn and Levi are brothers; weapons*ld of violence are their swords.
Let*ln my soul come not into their council; O*ld my glory, be not joined to their company. For*ln in their anger they killed men, and*ld in their willfulness they hamstrung oxen.
Cursed*ln be their anger, for it is fierce, and*ld their wrath, for it is cruel! I*ln will divide them in Jacob and*ld scatter them in Israel.
“Judah,*pn your brothers shall praise you; your*ld hand shall be on the neck of your enemies; your*ld father’s sons shall bow down before you.
Judah*ln is a lion’s cub; from*ld the prey, my son, you have gone up. He*ln stooped down; he crouched as a lion and*ld as a lioness; who dares rouse him?
The*ln scepter shall not depart from Judah, nor*ld the ruler’s staff from between his feet, until*ln tribute comes to him; and*ld to him shall be the obedience of the peoples.
Binding*ln his foal to the vine and*ld his donkey’s colt to the choice vine, he*ln has washed his garments in wine and*ld his vesture in the blood of grapes.
His*ln eyes are darker than wine, and*ld his teeth whiter than milk.
“Zebulun*pn shall dwell at the shore of the sea; he*ld shall become a haven for ships, and*ld his border shall be at Sidon.
“Issachar*pn is a strong donkey, crouching*ld between the sheepfolds.
He*ln saw that a resting place was good, and*ld that the land was pleasant, so*ln he bowed his shoulder to bear, and*ld became a servant at forced labor.
“Dan*pn shall judge his people as*ld one of the tribes of Israel.
Dan*ln shall be a serpent in the way, a*ld viper by the path, that*ln bites the horse’s heels so*ld that his rider falls backward.
I*ln wait for your salvation, O Lord.*s
“Raiders*pn shall raid Gad, but*ld he shall raid at their heels.
“Asher’s*pn food shall be rich, and*ld he shall yield royal delicacies.
“Naphtali*pn is a doe let loose that*ld bears beautiful fawns.
“Joseph*pn is a fruitful bough, a*ld fruitful bough by a spring; his*ld branches run over the wall.
The*ln archers bitterly attacked him, shot*ld at him, and harassed him severely,
yet*ln his bow remained unmoved; his*ld arms were made agile by*ln the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob (from*ld there is the Shepherd, the Stone of Israel),

by*ln the God of your father who will help you, by*ld the Almighty who will bless you with*ld blessings of heaven above, blessings*ln of the deep that crouches beneath, blessings*ld of the breasts and of the womb.

The*ln blessings of your father are*ld mighty beyond the blessings of my parents, up*ld to the bounties of the everlasting hills. May*ln they be on the head of Joseph, and*ld on the brow of him who was set apart from his brothers.
“Benjamin*pn is a ravenous wolf, in*ld the morning devouring the prey and*ld at evening dividing the spoil.”
Jacob’s Death and Burial
All*p these are the twelve tribes of Israel. This is what their father said to them as he blessed them, blessing each with the blessing suitable to him.
Then he commanded them and said to them, “I am to be gathered to my people; bury me with my fathers in the cave that is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,
in the cave that is in the field at Machpelah, to the east of Mamre, in the land of Canaan, which Abraham bought with the field from Ephron the Hittite to possess as a burying place.
There they buried Abraham and Sarah his wife. There they buried Isaac and Rebekah his wife, and there I buried Leah—
the field and the cave that is in it were bought from the Hittites.”
When Jacob finished commanding his sons, he drew up his feet into the bed and breathed his last and was gathered to his people.
